short_description: This function scales the input to a specfied range.
long_description: This function scales the input to a specfied range based on the statistic information.

input_tables.name: statistic
input_tables.description: The statistic input generated by ScaleMap

input_tables.name: input
input_tables.description: The input dataset for scale function.

argument_clauses.name: Method
argument_clauses.description: Specify one or more methods used to scale the dataset.  If multiple methods are specified, a column scalemethod is added to the output to identify the result of different methods. The permitted input values are [MEAN, SUM, USTD, STD, RANGE, MIDRANGE, MAXABS].

argument_clauses.name: Global
argument_clauses.description: If true, all the input columns are scaled to the same location and scale. Otherwise, each column will be scaled separately.  The default value is false.

argument_clauses.name: InputColumns
argument_clauses.description: The data columns that contain the attribute values of the samples in the input table. These columns must contain numeric values between -1e308 and 1e308. The input can be list of columns or ranges or a mixture. Format example: 'col1','[4:21]','[25:53]','col73'. Input columns must contain numeric SQL types.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.description: Columns from the input table to be passed through from input to output.

argument_clauses.name: Multiplier
argument_clauses.description: The result will multiple this factor. If a single value is given, it will be adopted in all the input columns. If a list is specified, each value will be associated with a input column in order.  The default value is 1.0.

argument_clauses.name: Intercept
argument_clauses.description: The result will add this factor. If a single value is given, it will be adopted in all the input columns. If a list is specified, each value will be associated with a input column in order.   The default value is 0.
